name: Heading
description: The Heading component is a helper to create automated semantic headings within a boundary of some rules.

props.name: text
props.doc: A heading, can be text or React.Node.

props.name: children
props.doc: A heading, can be text or React.Node.

props.name: size
props.doc: Define the typography [font-size](/uilib/typography/font-size) by a size _type_, e.g. `x-large`. Defaults to the predefined heading sizes.

props.name: level
props.doc: Overwrite the automated level handling to use a specific value to ensure correct level hierarchy.

props.name: increase
props.doc: If set to `true`, the heading level will be incremented by 1.

props.name: decrease
props.doc: If set to `true`, the heading level will be decremented by 1.

props.name: inherit
props.doc: If set to `true`, the heading last used level will be inherited. Also from inside a level context.

props.name: reset
props.doc: If set to `true`, the heading level will be reset to 2. You can give it a custom level if you need to, e.g. `reset(1)`.

props.name: skip_correction
props.doc: If set to `true`, the heading will not be corrected and warnings will not be shown. Warnings do not show up in **production builds** else either

props.name: debug
props.doc: If set to `true`, the content will have a prefix, showing the heading level.

props.name: debug_counter
props.doc: If set to `true`, the content will have both a prefix and a JSON log attached to both headings and level contexts.

props.name: element
props.doc: Define what HTML element should be used. If you use, e.g. a `span`, then `role="heading"` and `aria-level` gets set. Defaults to semantic heading element.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: proseMaxWidth
props.doc: Sets the maximum width based on character count. This will limit the text width to approximately the specified number of characters. Use `true` for a default value of 60ch.
